linefit

Class GraphArea

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • linefit.GraphArea
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, HasDataToSave, HasOptionsToSave

    public class GraphArea
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements HasOptionsToSave, HasDataToSave
    The main interface of LineFit. This class is responsible for drawing and calculating the graph as well as getting and allowing users to input data (all but menus)
    Since:
    <0.98.0
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Keith Rice
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  GraphArea.GraphAreaMouseListener
      A private that class that allows us to get input about the mouse's position on our frame
      class  GraphArea.GraphAxesPowers
      A class for holding the powers of the axes in the graph mainly used to return multiple values from getter functions
      class  GraphArea.GraphAxesRanges
      A class for holding the ranges of the axes in the graph mainly used to return multiple values from getter functions
      class  GraphArea.GraphMetaData
      A class for holding the metadata of the graph mainly used to return multiple values from getter functions
      class  GraphArea.ResultsDisplayData
      A class for holding the displayed results data of the graph mainly used to return multiple values from getter functions

      The pixels height the top bar which shows the cursor position is

      The width of the points we are using to draw the shapes on the graph

      The ratio used for determining the amount of space between labels in the Graph Area
      private int graphAreaBottomSpacing
      The spacing in pixels from the bottom of the graphing area container and the actual graph (same as to the x-axis line)
      private java.awt.Dimension graphAreaDimensions
      The current dimensions in pixels of the graph area before any are removed for padding
      private int graphAreaLeftSpacing
      The spacing in pixels from the left side of the graphing area container and the actual graph (same as to the y-axis line)
      private int graphAreaNameSpacing
      The spacing in pixels between the top of the graph and the graph name
      private int graphAreaRightSpacing
      The spacing in pixels from the right of the graphing area container to the right of the actual graph (same as the leftmost point of the x-axis)
      private int graphAreaTopSpacing
      The spacing in pixels from the top of the graphing area container to the top of the actual graph (same as the topmost point of the y-axis)
      private int graphHeightAfterPadding
      The height of the graph area in pixels after the pixels have been subtracted to account for the spacing padding on the top and bottom of the graph
      private java.lang.String graphName
      The name of the current graph
      private int graphNameWidth
      The width in pixels of the graph's name displayed above the graph
      private int graphWidthAfterPadding
      The width of the graph area in pixels after the pixels have been subtracted to account for the spacing padding on the sides of the graph
      private int positionOfOriginX
      The pixel location of the origin in the x direction
      private int positionOfOriginY
      The pixel location of the origin in the y direction
      boolean resultsAreDisplayedOnGraph
      Keeps track of if the results should be drawn on the graph itself
      (package private) int resultsDecimalPlaces
      The number of decimal places to use in the linear fit results
      private int resultsInbetweenSpacing
      The spacing in pixels between the lines in the results when they are displayed on the graph
      (package private) int resultsPositionX
      The x position in pixels of the bottom right corner of the results from the bottom right corner of the square formed by the axes
      (package private) int resultsPositionY
      The y position in pixels of the bottom right corner of the results from the bottom right corner of the square formed by the axes
      (package private) boolean resultsUseScientificNotation
      Whether or not to use scientific notation for the linear fit's results
      private static long serialVersionUID
      The current serial version UID that changes when the interface of the class is changed

      The height in pixels of the tick marks on the axes
      private double tickMarkRelativeValueX
      The distance along the x-axis that each tick mark represents
      private double tickMarkRelativeValueY
      The distance along the y-axis that each tick mark represents
      (package private) boolean useAxesPowers
      Keeps track of if powers are allowed to be extracted from the axes tick mark values and placed at the end of the axis
      (package private) boolean userDefinedAxes
      Keeps track of if the user has specified the minimums and maximums on the axes

      Keeps track of if the user has specified the powers to be used on each axis
      (package private) int xAxisDecimalPlaces
      The number of digits right of the decimal point to use for the values on the x-axis tick marks (Note: negative rounds to the left of the decimal place)

      The description that tells what the x-axis measures on this graph

      Keeps track of whether the x-axis currently has labels on its tick marks

      The current number of tick marks on the x-axis

      The power used/extracted from the values on the x-axis

      The spacing in pixels between the x-axis and the x10 power label at its end

      The spacing in pixels in order to center the numeral below the tick marks on the x-axis
      private int xAxisTickLabelSpacing
      The spacing in pixels between the tick marks on the x-axis and the numeral label under it

      The array of the DataDimensions to use when the x error/uncertainty should be displayed first

      Determines whether the user wants to use x or y errors/uncertainties when there is only three DataColumns in a DataSet.

      GraphArea(double defaultXAxisMinimum, double defaultXAxisMaximum, double defaultYAxisMinimum, double defaultYAxisMaximum, javax.swing.JComboBox<DataSet> dataSetSelectorToUse, javax.swing.JTextArea resultsPanelToUse)
      Constructor for our graph area that is called by LineFit to create the visual graph Note: Each LineFit should have only one GraphArea

      private void addCursorLocationToGraph(java.awt.Graphics2D graphGraphics) 
      (package private) void calculateAxesMinimumAndMaximumValues()
      Calculates the lengths of the axes based on the data points, unless the user has overridden this functionality, so that they are all on screen
      private void calculateGraphAreaRightSpacing(double fontSize)
      calculates the graph area's righ side spacing based on whether or not the power is displayed and the length of the last tick label
      (package private) void calculatePaddingForGraphArea(double fontSize, boolean spaceForCursorLocation)
      Calculates and places the correct values in the spacing variables in order to space them correctly base on how big the font is

      Converts an integer into a string containing subscript numbers
      (package private) int convertXCoordinateToPixel(double pointOnGraphX)
      Finds the pixel location on the graph of where the given x value is on the graph in the x direction
      (package private) int convertYCoordinateToPixel(double pointOnGraphY)
      Finds the pixel location on the graph of where the given y value is on the graph in the y direction

      Performs any processing needed after all the data has been read in

      int getLongestResultsLength()
      Finds the pixel length of the line of the data sets' linear fits with the longest length
      GraphArea.ResultsDisplayData GetResultsDisplayData()
      Gets the displayed results of the graph

      Gets the current description of the x-axis
      (package private) java.lang.String getYAxisDescription()
      Gets the current description of the y-axis
      boolean hasData()
      Checks to see if the Graph Area has any data in it
      void makeGraph(java.awt.Graphics2D graphGraphics, java.awt.Dimension graphMaximumDimensions, boolean leaveSpaceForCursorLocation, java.awt.Font fontToUse)
      The main workhorse function.
      void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
      We overwriting the paint function so that we can access the graphics in order to draw our graph This is also we were recalculate our graph in order to update changes
      boolean readInDataAndDataOptions(java.lang.String line, boolean newDataSet)
      Reads in data or an option related to the data from the passed in line
      boolean readInOption(java.lang.String lineRead)
      Reads in the options associated with exporting in from the LineFit data file
      (package private) void refreshAxesPower()
      Determines the power to use on the axes so that they stay small unless it is overridden by the user
      (package private) void registerDataSet(DataSet toRegister)
      Registers the given data set to this graph area by placing it in the DataSet selector box at the end but before the New Data Set option
      void retrieveAllDataAndDataOptions(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> variableNames, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> variableValues)
      Retrieve all the data and options associated with the data in the passed in array lists
      void retrieveAllOptions(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> variableNames, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> variableValues)
      Adds the names of the options as saved in the LineFit file and the values associated with them to the respective passed ArrayLists
      (package private) void setGraphName(java.lang.String graphName)
      Sets the graph's name to the inputed String
      (package private) void setThirdColumn(boolean xErrors)
      Sets the dataset's third column order so we can change whether we use only x errors of y errors
      (package private) void setXAxisDescription(java.lang.String axisDescription)
      Sets the description of the x-axis to the given String
      (package private) void setYAxisDescription(java.lang.String axisDescription)
      Sets the description of the y-axis to the given String
      (package private) int translateTickMarkInX(int tickNumber)
      This method determines the spacing in the x direction for the given tick mark that is being drawn on the x-axis
      (package private) int translateTickMarkInY(int tickNumber)
      This method determines the spacing in the y direction for the given tick mark that is being drawn on the y-axis
      (package private) void updateDataSetErrorOrder(DataSet toUpdateErrorOrderOf)
      Sets the dataset's error column order to the correct order based on the current graph settings

        The number of digits right of the decimal point to use for the values on the y-axis tick marks (Note: negative rounds to the left of the decimal place)

      • resultsDecimalPlaces

        int resultsDecimalPlaces
        The number of decimal places to use in the linear fit results

      • resultsAreDisplayedOnGraph

        public boolean resultsAreDisplayedOnGraph
        Keeps track of if the results should be drawn on the graph itself

      • resultsPositionX

        int resultsPositionX
        The x position in pixels of the bottom right corner of the results from the bottom right corner of the square formed by the axes

      • resultsPositionY

        int resultsPositionY
        The y position in pixels of the bottom right corner of the results from the bottom right corner of the square formed by the axes

      • resultsUseScientificNotation

        boolean resultsUseScientificNotation
        Whether or not to use scientific notation for the linear fit's results

      • dataSetSelector

        public javax.swing.JComboBox<DataSet> dataSetSelector
        The drop down selector box that allows us to add new datasets and that selects the current dataset to display the data of in the columns

      • fitResultsString

        private java.lang.String fitResultsString
        The linear fit's results as a string

      • fitResultsArea

        private javax.swing.JTextArea fitResultsArea
        The JTextArea in which the linear fit's results are displayed to the user. This is a TextArea instead of a Label so that the user can copy the results

      • xErrorsOnly

        boolean xErrorsOnly
        Determines whether the user wants to use x or y errors/uncertainties when there is only three DataColumns in a DataSet. True means to use x errors/uncertainties and false means to use y errors/uncertainties.

      • xDimensionFirst

        private static final DataDimension[] xDimensionFirst
        The array of the DataDimensions to use when the x error/uncertainty should be displayed first

      • yDimensionFirst

        private static final DataDimension[] yDimensionFirst
        The array of the DataDimensions to use when the y error/uncertainty should be displayed first

          javax.swing.JTextArea resultsPanelToUse)

        defaultXAxisMinimum - The starting minimum value on the x-axis
        defaultXAxisMaximum - The starting maximum value on the x-axis

        defaultYAxisMaximum - The starting maximum value on the y-axis
        dataSetSelectorToUse - The data set selector that contains all the data sets to draw on the graph

      • makeGraph

        public void makeGraph(java.awt.Graphics2D graphGraphics,
                      java.awt.Dimension graphMaximumDimensions,
                      boolean leaveSpaceForCursorLocation,
                      java.awt.Font fontToUse)
        The main workhorse function. It is here that the data all gets plotted and the graph gets drawn on the screen and to a file
        Parameters:
        graphGraphics - The graphics we are using to draw the graph with
        graphMaximumDimensions - The dimensions of the Graph area to which we are drawing
        leaveSpaceForCursorLocation - true if space should be left to draw the cursor position (i.e. if it is not being drawn for an export)
        fontToUse - The font to use for drawing the graph
